Orphapacket.Label: Persistent left superior vena cava connecting through coronary sinus to left-sided atrium

Synonyms.Synonym: Persistent left SVC connecting through coronary sinus to left-sided atrium

TextSection.Contents: A rare congenital vascular malformation of the major vessels characterized by a persitent left superior vena cava which drains through the left coronary sinus to the left atrium. Patients are usually asymptomatic and discovered incidentally however hypoxia cyanosis murmurs palpitations cardiac structural anomalies (e.g. atrial septal defect bicuspid aortic valve cor triatrium) and risk of paradoxical embolization may be associated.

Parent.Label: Congenital anomaly of superior vena cava
